column4: I tried   $su - <username> -c "iptables"    but it comes back saying    -su: iptables: command not found
it works with other commands I tried... not iptables though
I am getting PISSED.
how can iptables magically not be found by -su?
everything else is there! damn!
maybe you should just walk away and chill out for a bit.
open a web browser.
then what?
browse the web. if you can, then NAT is working
I want to know what mode it is in though. ie moderate, open, or strict
you're using xbox lingo... that's not how we look at nat here
I know I am using xbox lingo :P
I did research on NAT but couldn't really find how those terms translated
so I am not particularly sure what to look for. I am running through two networks and I want to know which one has the NAT problems, or both
it's all right here: http://forum.teamxbox.com/showthread.php?t=451043  they refer to what ports are being forwarded
thanks
there's also this: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=538796
because opera sucks
but it is running, for example, JBox2D much better
Firefox will repeatedly freeze every few seconds while Opera will run it smoothly
jbox2d is a web browser?
no it is a physics engine in java and you can test it as a browser applet
oh, I misread-sorry
